member.name: M:Apache.NMS.Test.ConnectionTest.TwoConnections
member.summary: Verify that it is possible to create multiple connections to the broker. There was a bug in the connection factory which set the clientId member which made it impossible to create an additional connection.

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.Test.ConnectionTest.TestStoppedConsumerHoldsMessagesTillStarted
member.summary: Tests if the consumer receives the messages that were sent before the connection was started.

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.Test.ConnectionTest.TestMultipleConnectionStops
member.summary: Tests if the consumer is able to receive messages eveb when the connecction restarts multiple times.

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.Test.MessageSelectorTest.FilterIgnoredMessagesSlowConsumerTest(System.String)
member.summary: A slow consumer will trigger the producer flow control on the broker when the destination is a queue. It will also trigger the consumer flow control by slowing down the feed to all of the consumers on the queue to only send messages as fast as the slowest consumer can run. When sending to a topic, the producer will not be slowed down, and consumers will be allowed to run as fast as they can go. Since this test can take a long time to run, it is marked as explicit.

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.Test.TextMessageTest.AssertTextMessageEqual(Apache.NMS.IMessage,Apache.NMS.IMessage)
member.summary: Assert that two messages are ITextMessages and their text bodies are equal.

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.Test.TransactionTest.AssertTextMessageEqual(Apache.NMS.IMessage,Apache.NMS.IMessage,System.String)
member.summary: Assert that two messages are ITextMessages and their text bodies are equal.
